data.chText: 出卖；泄露（机密）
data.enText: to give information about sb/sth to an enemy

data.chText: 他们多年来一直在向俄罗斯泄露国家机密。
data.enText: For years they had been betraying state secrets to Russia.

data.chText: 有人收买他出卖他的同事。
data.enText: He was offered money to betray his colleagues.

data.chText: 辜负；对…不忠
data.enText: to hurt sb who trusts you, especially by not being loyal or faithful to them

data.chText: 她发现他的真实情况后，感到受了欺骗。
data.enText: She felt betrayed when she found out the truth about him.

data.chText: 她一次又一次地辜负了他的信任。
data.enText: She betrayed his trust over and over again.

data.chText: 我从未听说过她泄露秘密。
data.enText: I have never known her to betray a confidence (= tell other people sth that should be kept secret) .

data.chText: 背叛（原则或信仰）
data.enText: to ignore your principles or beliefs in order to achieve sth or gain an advantage for yourself

data.chText: 有人指责他背弃了他先前的社会主义理想。
data.enText: He has been accused of betraying his former socialist ideals.

data.chText: （无意中）泄露信息，流露情感
data.enText: to tell sb or make them aware of a piece of information, a feeling, etc., usually without meaning to

data.chText: 他的声音掩盖不了内心的担忧。
data.enText: His voice betrayed the worry he was trying to hide.

data.chText: 她害怕说话时泄了自己的底。
data.enText: She was terrified of saying something that would make her betray herself (= show her feelings or who she was) .

data.text: cheat ♦ fool ♦ deceive ♦ betray ♦ take in ♦ trick ♦ con

data.chText: 以上各词均含使人误信之义，尤指有目的地这样做。
data.enText: These words all mean to make sb believe sth that is not true, especially in order to get what you want.
cheat

data.chText: 指为得到钱财或其他东西而欺骗、欺诈：
data.enText: to make sb believe sth that is not true, in order to get money or sth else from them

data.chText: 她被指控企图蒙骗税务员。
data.enText: She is accused of attempting to cheat the taxman.

data.chText: 他骗取了这份工作。
data.enText: He cheated his way into the job.

data.chText: cheat亦指在游戏、竞赛或考试中作弊、舞弊：
data.enText: Cheat also means to act in a dishonest way in order to gain an advantage, especially in a game, competition or exam.

data.chText: 你们不许看答案，那是作弊。
data.enText: You're not allowed to look at the answers─ that's cheating .
fool

data.chText: 指蒙骗、愚弄：
data.enText: to make sb believe sth that is not true, especially in order to laugh at them or to get what you want

data.chText: 别上当受骗，同他们一起搞什么投资。
data.enText: Just don't be fooled into investing any money with them.
deceive

data.chText: 尤指利用别人的信任欺骗、蒙骗、诓骗：
data.enText: to make sb believe sth that is not true, especially sb who trusts you, in order to get what you want

data.chText: 她把他所有的积蓄都骗出来了。
data.enText: She deceived him into handing over all his savings.
betray

data.chText: 指辜负别人的信任：
data.enText: to hurt sb who trusts you, especially by deceiving them or not being loyal to them

data.chText: 她发现他的真实情况时，感到受了欺骗。
data.enText: She felt betrayed when she found out the truth about him.
take sb in

data.chText: 通常指为个人目的而欺骗、蒙骗：
data.enText: [often passive] to deceive sb, usually in order to get what you want

data.chText: 我被她的花言巧语蒙骗了。
data.enText: I was taken in by her story.
trick

data.chText: 尤指以巧妙的方式欺骗、欺诈
data.enText: to deceive sb, especially in a clever way, in order to get what you want
con

data.chText: 尤指为钱财或使人为自己做事而欺骗、哄骗、诈骗：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to deceive sb, especially in order to get money from them or get them to do sth for you

data.chText: 他们被骗走了10万英镑。
data.enText: They had been conned out of £100 000.

data.chText: 词语辨析
以上各词多含使人信以为真之义，但其中有些词贬义较另一些词强。deceive大概贬义最强，主要指欺骗朋友、亲戚或其他认识和信任的人。被相信能够照顾自己利益的有权力者欺骗可用cheat/betray。通过假装或花言巧语等骗人用take sb in。指哄骗、愚弄用cheat/fool/trick/con。只为开玩笑可用fool。如果被戏弄者是应该受到惩罚的坏人，可用trick，表示计谋巧妙。
data.enText: Many of these words involve making sb believe sth that is not true, but some of them are more disapproving than others. Deceive is probably the worst because people typically deceive friends, relations and others who know and trust them. People may feel cheated/betrayed by sb in authority who they trusted to look after their interests. If sb takes you in they may do it by acting a part and using words and charm effectively. If sb cheats/fools/tricks/cons you, they may get sth from you and make you feel stupid. However, sb might fool you just as a joke; and to trick sb is sometimes seen as a clever thing to do, if the person being tricked is seen as a bad person who deserves it.
which word?
to cheat/fool/trick/con sb out of sth
to cheat/fool/deceive/betray/trick/con sb into doing sth
to feel cheated/fooled/deceived/betrayed/tricked/conned
to fool/deceive yourself
to cheat/trick/con your way into sth

ex.enText: She betrayed the secrets of her company.

ex.chText: 树后面露出的角暴露了鹿的藏身之地。
ex.enText: A visible antler behind the tree betrayed the presence of the deer.

synonyms.bx: 主要指不忠于誓约或辜负信任；也可以指有意泄露秘密或出于无意暴露隐蔽的事物。

ex.chText: 他的妻子不知道他一直对她不忠。
ex.enText: His wife has no idea that he has been cheating on her all along.

ex.chText: 他声称那里的妇女几乎有一半对自己的伴侣不忠。
ex.enText: He claims that almost half of the women there cheat on their partners.

synonyms.bx: 尤指对配偶或性伴侣不忠。
主要指向警方告发某人的违法活动。

ex.chText: 他们试图找出是谁出卖了他们。
ex.enText: They tried to find out who had ratted on them.

ex.chText: 他们指责当地政府没有履行承诺。
ex.enText: They accused the local government of ratting on its promises.

synonyms.bx: 主要指向掌权者告发某人，也指违背所作的承诺，常后接介词 on。

example: He told on his classmate who had cheated on the exam

tr: cause someone to believe an untruth
example: The insurance company deceived me when they told me they were covering my house
Her smile betrayed her true feelings
His sense of smell failed him this time
His children failed him in the crisis

tr: deliver to an enemy by treachery
be sexually unfaithful to one's partner in marriage

value.def: If you betray someone who loves or trusts you, your actions hurt and disappoint them.

example.ex: When I tell someone I will not betray his confidence I keep my word...
example.tran: 如果我告诉某人我不会辜负他的信任，我就会恪守诺言。

example.ex: The President betrayed them when he went back on his promise not to raise taxes.
example.tran: 总统背叛了他们，违背了不加税的诺言。

example.ex: She was her friend and now calls her a betrayer.
example.tran: 她曾经是她的朋友，现在却叫她叛徒。

value.def: If someone betrays their country or their friends, they give information to an enemy, putting their country's security or their friends' safety at risk.

example.ex: They offered me money if I would betray my associates...
example.tran: 他们提出来只要我供出同伙就给我钱。

example.ex: The group were informers, and they betrayed the plan to the Germans.
example.tran: 这帮人是告密者，他们把计划泄露给了德国人。
“叛徒！”她尖叫道。“英格兰的叛徒！”

value.def: If you betray an ideal or your principles, you say or do something which goes against those beliefs.

example.ex: We betray the ideals of our country when we support capital punishment.
example.tran: 如果我们支持死刑，那就背弃了我们立国的理念。

example.ex: Babearth regarded the middle classes as the betrayers of the Revolution.
example.tran: 巴博施把中产阶级看作是革命的叛徒。

value.def: If you betray a feeling or quality, you show it without intending to.

example.ex: She studied his face, but it betrayed nothing...
example.tran: 她仔细端详了一番他的脸，但什么也没有看出来。

example.ex: He nodded his head instead of saying anything where his voice might betray him.
example.tran: 他一言不发，只是点头，因为一开口可能会露出破绽。
